intro: Gnidia gnidioides, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central column. Gnidia gnidioides produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation.
